profiles:
Summary Research professional with experience in medicinal chemistry, radiochemistry, pre-clinical/clinical PET imaging, and molecular biology. Currently working in biotech start-up EpiBiome, a bacteriophage company, located in the Johnson & Johnson Innovation Lab in South San Francisco. My goal within the company is to further develop my scientific skill set in a dynamic and fast paced environment that will enable and encourage professional growth in business management, external affairs and product development.

www.epibiome.com Experience Scientist, Molecular Biologist EpiBiome November 2014  – Present (10 months) San Francisco, California Molecular biology: Bacterial DNA extraction from a variety of sample types, quantification, PCR, gel electrophoresis, library preparation, next-generation sequencing on Illumina MiSeq, shotgun metagenomics, whole genome sequencing, 16S amplicon sequencing. 
Manufacturing & Operations 
Research & Development 
 
 Radiochemistry Research Assistant Stanford University Medical Center May 2012  –  November 2014  (2 years 7 months) Standford University Medical Center, Cyclotron and Radiochemistry Facility Synthesis of F-18, C-11, Cu-64 and Ga-68 labeled radiopharmaceuticals for clinic and research Performing relevant QA/QC 
Operation of the cyclotron (GE PETtrace) 
Clinical translation of tracers 
Lab management and administrative functions - setting up the new clinical GMP lab, working with facilities staff and outside product vendors, organizing cyclotron schedule, performing maintenance of equipment. 
Training new staff 
Trouble-shooting issues with chemistry or technical equipment 
Writings SOPs, generating INDs for new clinical tracers, reviewing/editing journal articles. Master's Student in Radiochemistry/PET Biotesting University of Ottawa Heart Institute September 2009  –  April 2012  (2 years 8 months) Ottawa, Ontario Design and synthesis of novel F-18 labeled AT1 receptor PET tracer, including cold synthesis, translation to hot chemistry in an automated module (FX N Pro), metabolite analysis (by column switch HPLC) and microPET imaging (Siemens microPET) in normal rats to generate SUV/TAC. Submission Screening Officer Health Canada May 2008  –  August 2008  (4 months) Ottawa, Canada Co-op Position. Screened incoming notifications and amendments to Clinical Trials Applications (CTA). Also took on a secondary role with the Special Access Programme (SAP) where I screened requests for drugs not approved for sale in Canada. Medicinal Chemistry Researcher MethylGene Inc. January 2007  –  August 2007  (8 months) Co-op Position Scientist, Molecular Biologist EpiBiome November 2014  – Present (10 months) San Francisco, California Molecular biology: Bacterial DNA extraction from a variety of sample types, quantification, PCR, gel electrophoresis, library preparation, next-generation sequencing on Illumina MiSeq, shotgun metagenomics, whole genome sequencing, 16S amplicon sequencing.

Summary I am an analytical chemist with vast experience of supporting phase ll drug development.  
Besides the regular activities of drug product support (dissolution, assay, stability etc...), I also developed chromatography methods for active pharmaceutical ingredients and their intermediates and for detection of genotoxic impurities. I am experienced in RP-LC, chiral-LC/SFC, HILIC, and GC-FID method development. Summary I am an analytical chemist with vast experience of supporting phase ll drug development.  
Besides the regular activities of drug product support (dissolution, assay, stability etc...), I also developed chromatography methods for active pharmaceutical ingredients and their intermediates and for detection of genotoxic impurities. I am experienced in RP-LC, chiral-LC/SFC, HILIC, and GC-FID method development. I am an analytical chemist with vast experience of supporting phase ll drug development.

I am experienced in RP-LC, chiral-LC/SFC, HILIC, and GC-FID method development. Experience Senior Research Associate II Gilead Sciences February 2015  – Present (7 months) Foster City Phase III support for combo drug product. Analytical Chemistry Research Associate Genentech June 2012  –  February 2015  (2 years 9 months) South San Francisco Phase ll support for drug product (DP) and active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) development. HPLC/ UPLC method development for late stage research projects. Ion chromatography with IC systems and with HPLC (based on HILIC and CAD detection). Dissolution / disintegration tests, content and blend uniformity. HSGC with FID and EI-MS detection. H-1/C-13 NMR. Particle size analysis and more. Radiochemistry Research Assistant Stanford University Medical Center January 2011  –  June 2012  (1 year 6 months) Production of imaging probes for proliferation, angiogenesis and metabolism. 
Reviewing and editing of SOP's, master batch recordes and QC forms.
